original: pas gnod sems med pa'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: pas gnod sems med pa'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “How does the Tathāgata, who is free from anger, know the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the element of anger?”

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata knows thus:

original: shes pa gang gis gnod sems med pa'i khams shes pa yongs su shes /
analyzed: shes pa gang gis gnod sems med pa'i khams shes pa yongs su shes /
translated: ‘The knowledge by which the element of anger is known,

original: khong du chud /
analyzed: khong du chud /
translated: understood,

original: mngon sum du byas pa'i 'gog pa gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su lta bar gnas pa'am /🔽gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: mngon sum du byas pa'i 'gog pa gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su lta bar gnas pa'am / gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: and actualized, if one dwells contemplating the taste of cessation,🔽or if one dwells contemplating the danger of cessation,

original: gal te nges par 'byung bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa 'di ni /
analyzed: gal te nges par 'byung bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa 'di ni /
translated: or if one dwells contemplating the escape from cessation,

original: gnod sems med pa'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnod sems med pa'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: this is called the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the element of anger.🔽’

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata fully knows

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gnod sems med pa'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung pa nas de bzhin du sbyar te /🔽de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gnod sems med pa'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung pa nas de bzhin du sbyar te / de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Householder, when asked, ‘How does the Tathāgata, who has understood the cessation of the element of non-hatred, know the path the cessation of the element of non-hatred? ’ he would answer after a kalpa had passed.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i khams shes pa yang dag pa ji ltar ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /🔽khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin @80b gshegs pas lta bar gyur pa drug cu rtsa gnyis dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i khams shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //🔽de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i khams shes pa yang dag pa ji ltar ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /🔽khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin @80b gshegs pas lta bar gyur pa drug cu rtsa gnyis dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i khams shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //🔽de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: “Householder, when asked, ‘

original: rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i khams shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i khams shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the knowledge of the element of non-violence.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji ltar ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji ltar ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata has fully and perfectly realized it.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i khams shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i khams shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: If one were to ask for an answer to this question, the Tathāgata would give an answer for an eon, or for even more than an eon.

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: He would enjoy it in this place, from the sandalwood ground up to the multistoried pavilion.

original: kun 'byung ba dang; 'gog pa dang / lam yang sngar ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang; 'gog pa dang / lam yang sngar ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The origin, the cessation, and the path are as explained above.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: Householder, how is it

original: de bzhin gshegs pas log par lta ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas log par lta ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: that the Tathāgata has full knowledge of the understanding of wrong views?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas log par lta ba la log par lta ba zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas log par lta ba la log par lta ba zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, here the Tathāgata has full knowledge of wrong views as they really are as ‘wrong views.’

original: de 'di'i lta ba yang dag pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de 'di'i lta ba yang dag pa yin zhe na /
translated: If you ask why, it is because this is his right view.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas log par lta ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas log par lta ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Thus the Tathāgata, with his discernment of the knowledge of the origin of wrong views, knows the reality of wrong views.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /🔽de @81a *// ni; tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pas log par lta ba shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te / de @81a *// ni; tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na / de bzhin gshegs pas log par lta ba shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata, with his discernment of the knowledge of the cessation of wrong views, know the reality of wrong views?🔽Householder, the Tathāgata, with his discernment of the knowledge of the cessation of wrong views, knows the reality of wrong views in such a way that he does not engage in the activities of the mind, does not engage in the activities of the intellect, and does not engage in the activities of consciousness.🔽“Householder, how does the Tathāgata, with his discernment of the knowledge of the cessation of wrong views, know the reality of wrong views?🔽“Householder, the Tathāgata, with his discernment of the knowledge of the cessation of wrong views, knows the reality of wrong views in such a way that he does not engage in the activities of the mind, does not engage in the activities of the intellect, and does not engage in the activities of consciousness.🔽“Householder, how does the Tathāgata, with his discernment of the knowledge of the cessation of wrong views, know the reality of wrong views?🔽“Householder, the Tathāgata, with his discernment of the knowledge of the cessation of wrong views, knows the reality of wrong views in such a way that he does not engage in the activities of the mind, does not engage in the activities of the intellect, and does not engage in the activities of consciousness.

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas log par lta ba shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa dang /🔽khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas log par lta ba shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa dang /🔽khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata, with his discernment of the knowledge of the cessation of wrong views, know the reality of wrong views?

original: rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis log par lta ba shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa de /
analyzed: rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis log par lta ba shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa de /
translated: “What are the causes and conditions by which the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the origin of wrong views is accomplished?

original: de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: The Tathāgata has understood it as it really is.

original: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas de bzhin du sbyar te thams cad la'ang bya'o //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas de bzhin du sbyar te thams cad la'ang bya'o // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: If one abides in the observation of impermanence, and so on, as before, it should be applied to all.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'das pa'i khams shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'das pa'i khams shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata understand the past element as it really is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'das pa'i khams su gyur pa byung ba dang / skyes pa dang / kun nas skyes pa dang / shin tu byung ba dang / rab tu byung ba @81b dang / 'das pa'i char gyur pa dang /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'das pa'i khams su gyur pa byung ba dang / skyes pa dang / kun nas skyes pa dang / shin tu byung ba dang / rab tu byung ba @81b dang / 'das pa'i char gyur pa dang /
translated: “Householder, in this case, the Tathāgata has understood as it really is the past element that has arisen, that has been born, that has been produced, that has been manifested, that has appeared, that has been in the past,

original: 'das pa'i rgyud ma chad pa dang / 'das pa'i dus kyis bzung ba gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: 'das pa'i rgyud ma chad pa dang / 'das pa'i dus kyis bzung ba gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: that has not been interrupted in the past, and that has been grasped by the past time.

original: 'das pa'i khams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'das pa'i khams zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the past element.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata fully knows that.🔽“If you ask in which way the Tathāgata fully knows the knowledge of the dhātu of the past, having asked he would reply for an eon, and so on as before.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'das pa'i khams shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /🔽de ni tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod bar 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pas 'das pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'das pa'i khams shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te / de ni tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod bar 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na / de bzhin gshegs pas 'das pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, if you ask in which way the Tathāgata fully knows the knowledge of the dhātu of the future, having asked he would reply for an eon, and so on as before.🔽“Householder, if you ask in which way the Tathāgata fully knows the knowledge of the dhātu of the present, having asked he would reply for an eon, and so on as before.🔽“Householder, if you ask in which way the Tathāgata fully knows the knowledge of the arising of the dhātu of the past, having asked he would reply for an eon, and so on as before.

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, if you ask in which way the Tathāgata fully knows the knowledge of the arising of the dhātu of the future, having asked he would reply for an eon, and so on as before.🔽“Householder, if you ask in which way the Tathāgata fully knows the knowledge of the arising of the dhātu of the present, having asked he would reply for an eon, and so on as before.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas 'das pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa dang / khyim bdag /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas 'das pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa dang / khyim bdag /
translated: “Householder, if you ask in which way the Tathāgata fully knows the knowledge of the cessation of the dhātu of the past, having asked he would reply for an eon, and so on as before.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, if you ask in which way the Tathāgata fully knows the knowledge of the cessation of the dhātu of the future, having asked he would reply for an eon, and so on as before.🔽“Householder, if you ask in which way the Tathāgata fully knows the knowledge of the cessation of the dhātu of the present, having asked he would reply for an eon, and so on as before.🔽“Householder, if you ask in which way the Tathāgata fully knows the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the dhātu of the past, having asked he would reply for an eon, and so on as before.🔽“Householder, if you ask in which way the Tathāgata fully knows the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the dhātu of the future, having asked he would

original: rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis 'das pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis 'das pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: What are the causes and conditions by which the knowledge of the arising of the past element is accomplished?

original: gal te mi rtag pa rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas de bzhin du sbyar te thams cad la'ang bya'o //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar @82a *//
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas de bzhin du sbyar te thams cad la'ang bya'o // khyim bdag / ji ltar @82a *//
translated: If one abides in the contemplation of impermanence, and so on, up to the contemplation of non-self, then the knowledge of the arising of the past element will be accomplished.

original: na; de bzhin gshegs pas ma 'ongs pa'i khams shes pa yang dag pa ji ltar ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: na; de bzhin gshegs pas ma 'ongs pa'i khams shes pa yang dag pa ji ltar ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: Householder, how does the Tathāgata know the future element as it really is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas khams ma skyes pa dang / kun nas ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang / kun nas ma byung ba dang / rab tu ma byung ba dang / shin tu ma byung ba dang / ma 'ongs par gyur pa dang /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas khams ma skyes pa dang / kun nas ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang / kun nas ma byung ba dang / rab tu ma byung ba dang / shin tu ma byung ba dang / ma 'ongs par gyur pa dang /
translated: Householder, here the Tathāgata knows the unborn, unarisen, unoriginated, unproduced, non-existent, non-becoming, future element,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i rgyud du gyur pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i rgyud ma chad pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyis bzung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus ma chad pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i rgyud du gyur pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i rgyud ma chad pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyis bzung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus ma chad pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: The future element is that which has not yet arisen, that which has not yet occurred, that which has not yet been born, that which has not yet died, that which has not yet come into the present, that which has not yet been actualized, that which is not yet manifest, that which is included in the future, that which has not yet passed beyond the future, that which is not yet present, and that which is not yet past.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i khams shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i khams shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the knowledge of the future element.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang sngar ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang sngar ji skad bstan pa bzhin no // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: The origination, cessation, and path of the future element should be understood as they were explained above.🔽“Householder, how does the Tathāgata know the present element as it really is?

original: de bzhin gshegs pas da ltar byung ba'i khams shes pa yang dag pa ji ltar ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas da ltar byung ba'i khams shes pa yang dag pa ji ltar ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: Householder, here the Tathāgata knows the present element as the present element.

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas khams skyes pa dang / kun nas skyes pa dang / byung ba dang / kun nas byung ba dang / rab tu byung ba dang / da ltar byung ba dang / da ltar byung ba'i rgyud du gyur pa dang /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas khams skyes pa dang / kun nas skyes pa dang / byung ba dang / kun nas byung ba dang / rab tu byung ba dang / da ltar byung ba dang / da ltar byung ba'i rgyud du gyur pa dang /
translated: The present element is that which has arisen, that which has occurred, that which has been born, that which has died, that which has come into the present, that which has been actualized, that which is manifest, that which is included in the present, that which has passed beyond the future, that which is not yet past, and that which is not yet future.

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus kyis bzung ba dang / da ltar byung ba'i rgyud ma chad pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus kyis bzung ba dang / da ltar byung ba'i rgyud ma chad pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: The present element is that which is grasped by the present time and that which is the uninterrupted continuum of the present.

original: da ltar byung ba'i khams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i khams zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the present element.

original: de de bzhin gshegs @82b pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs @82b pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata has thoroughly known the present element just as it is.

original: sngar ji skad bstan pa bzhin nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pas da ltar byung ba'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: sngar ji skad bstan pa bzhin nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na / de bzhin gshegs pas da ltar byung ba'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: As was said previously, up to the enjoyment of the present element.🔽“Householder, how does the Tathāgata have the right, perfect knowledge of the knowledge of the arising of the present element?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas da ltar byung ba'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa de de bzhin gshegs pas
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas da ltar byung ba'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa de de bzhin gshegs pas
translated: “Householder, here the Tathāgata has thoroughly known this: ‘Having planted the roots of virtue with immeasurable lord buddhas, the knowledge of the arising of the present element will be accomplished.’

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //🔽khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to // khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He knows the present elements just as they are.

original: rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis da ltar byung ba'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis da ltar byung ba'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Moreover, the Tathāgata understands in accordance with reality the causes and conditions by which the knowledge of the arising of the present elements is accomplished.

original: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: If one abides in the observation of impermanence, up to if one abides in the observation of opposition, the Tathāgata knows that just as it is.

original: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /🔽da ltar byung ba'i @83a *//
analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni / da ltar byung ba'i @83a *//
translated: The knowledge, seeing, illumination, realization, full understanding, and expertise regarding that

original: khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes ba zhes bya ste /
translated: is called the knowledge of the arising of the present elements.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata has fully understood the present element of the world as it really is.🔽“If someone were to ask you, ‘What is the origin of the present element of the world?🔽’ you should answer him, ‘It is the desire and love that arise from grasping.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa da ltar byung ba'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa da ltar byung ba'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: ’ If he were to ask, ‘What is the cessation of the present element of the world?

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: ’ you should answer him, ‘It is the cessation of the desire and love that arise from grasping.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang sngar ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang sngar ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: ’ If he were to ask, ‘What is the path of the cessation of the present element of the world?🔽’ you should answer him, ‘It is the noble eightfold path, from right view to right concentration—eight factors.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na; de bzhin gshegs pas dge ba'i khams shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na; de bzhin gshegs pas dge ba'i khams shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: ’ “Householder, how does the Tathāgata have a full understanding of the wholesome element as it really is?

original: khyim pa dag /
analyzed: khyim pa dag /
translated: Householder,

original: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang yang dag par ldan pa'i khams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang yang dag par ldan pa'i khams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: the Tathāgata has a full understanding of the wholesome element that is associated with the ten wholesome courses of action as it really is.

original: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: The knowledge, seeing, illumination, realization, discernment, and expertise that are in relation to that are

original: dge ba'i khams shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i khams shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: called the knowledge of the wholesome constituent.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata has perfect knowledge of the knowledge of the wholesome constituent just as it is.🔽If one were to ask why, it is because the Tathāgata has the power of knowledge that is in accord with the way things are.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dge ba'i khams shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus ba na bskal bar lan gsum ba nas de bzhin du sbyar @83b te; de ni /🔽tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dge ba'i khams shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus ba na bskal bar lan gsum ba nas de bzhin du sbyar @83b te; de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, has the power of knowledge that is in accord with the way things are in relation to the knowledge of the wholesome constituent.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas dge ba'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas dge ba'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: Householder, how does the Tathāgata have the knowledge that is in accord with the way things are in relation to the knowledge of the arising of the wholesome constituent?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, in this case the Tathāgata knows thus:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas dge ba'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas dge ba'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Having planted the roots of virtue with immeasurable Buddha Bhagavats, the knowledge of the arising of the element of virtue is accomplished. The Tathagata knows it as it really is.

original: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Moreover, the Tathagata knows in this way:

original: rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis dge pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis dge pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: The causes and conditions by which the knowledge of the arising of the element of virtue is accomplished, those causes and conditions he knows as they really are.

original: gsal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gsal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: If he abides in observing impermanence, up to if he abides in observing opposition, the Tathagata knows it as it really is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dge ba'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /🔽de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang @84a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dge ba'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te / de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang @84a *//
translated: “Householder, when asked, ‘What is the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the wholesome constituent? ’ the Tathāgata would answer, ‘It is the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the wholesome constituent. ’ And he would explain it in the same way up to ‘It is the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the wholesome constituent. ’🔽“Householder, when asked, ‘What is the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the wholesome constituent? ’ the Tathāgata would answer, ‘It is the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the wholesome constituent. ’ And he would explain it in the same way up to ‘It is the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the wholesome constituent. ’🔽“Householder, when asked, ‘What is the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the wholesome constituent? ’ the Tathāgata would answer, ‘It is the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the wholesome constituent. ’ And he would explain it in the same way up to ‘It is the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the wholesome constituent. ’

original: bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pas dge ba'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na / de bzhin gshegs pas dge ba'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, when asked, ‘What is the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the wholesome constituent? ’ the Tathāgata would answer, ‘It is the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the wholesome constituent. ’ And he would explain it in the same way up to ‘It is the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the wholesome constituent. ’🔽“Householder, when asked, ‘What is the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the wholesome constituent? ’ the Tathāgata would answer, ‘It is the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the wholesome constituent. ’ And he would explain it in the same way up to ‘It is the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the wholesome constituent. ’

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /🔽sems can dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don byas shing don ma yin pa bzlog la /🔽snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal te /🔽sems can dpag tu med pa rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas nas bde ba la btsud pa ni /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te / sems can dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don byas shing don ma yin pa bzlog la / snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal te / sems can dpag tu med pa rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas nas bde ba la btsud pa ni /
translated: “Householder, when asked, ‘What is the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the wholesome constituent? ’ the Tathāgata would answer, ‘It is the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the wholesome constituent. ’ And he would explain it in the same way up to ‘It is the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the wholesome constituent. ’

original: dge ba'i khams shes pa 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i khams shes pa 'gog pa ste /
translated: “Householder, when asked, ‘What is the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the wholesome constituent? ’ the Tathāgata would answer, ‘It is the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of

original: de'ang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: de'ang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i chos can no //
translated: It is also unborn from the beginning.

original: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: The knowledge, seeing, clarity, realization, full understanding, and expertise regarding this are

original: dge ba'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: called the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the wholesome constituent.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata has fully known the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the wholesome constituent as it really is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dge ba'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dge ba'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: When asked, the Tathāgata would answer about the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the wholesome constituent for an eon, and so on as before.

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs @84b spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs @84b spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: He would enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and the mansion.

original: dge ba'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i la ma shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: dge ba'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i la ma shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata, who has knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the wholesome constituent, know as it really is the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the wholesome constituent?🔽“

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa shes pa gang gis dge ba'i khams shes pa yongs su shes /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa shes pa gang gis dge ba'i khams shes pa yongs su shes /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata has the knowledge of the wholesome element.

original: khong du chud /🔽mngon sum du byas pa'i 'gog pa gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /🔽gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: khong du chud / mngon sum du byas pa'i 'gog pa gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am / gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: He has fully known,🔽understood, and realized the cessation of the knowledge of the wholesome element.🔽If he abides observing the disadvantages of the wholesome element,

original: gal te nges par 'byung bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa 'di ni /
analyzed: gal te nges par 'byung bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa 'di ni /
translated: or if he abides observing the escape from the wholesome element,

original: dge ba'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: that is called the knowledge of the path leading to the cessation of the knowledge of the wholesome element.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata has fully known that just as it is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dge ba'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung pa nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dge ba'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung pa nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: If questioned about the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the path leading to the cessation of the knowledge of the wholesome element, he would answer for an eon or more than an eon.

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽bam po lnga pa /
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽bam po lnga pa /
translated: He would enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and the mansion.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: Householder, how is it that you are not afraid of the lower realms?🔽🔽

original: de bzhin gshegs pas mi dge ba'i khams shes pa yang dag pa ji ltar ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas mi dge ba'i khams shes pa yang dag pa ji ltar ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata know as it really is the knowledge of the unwholesome constituent?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams dang yang @85a *//🔽dag par ldan pa'i khams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //🔽de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams dang yang @85a *// dag par ldan pa'i khams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to // de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: “Householder, here the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the unwholesome constituent is based on the ten unwholesome courses of action.

original: mi dge ba'i khams shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i khams shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The knowledge, seeing, clarity, realization, comprehension, and expertise regarding that are called the knowledge of the unwholesome constituent.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata fully understands as it really is the knowledge of the unwholesome constituent.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mi dge ba'i khams shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mi dge ba'i khams shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: When questioned about that knowledge of the unwholesome constituent, the Tathāgata would answer for an eon and more.

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: He will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and this fine house.🔽“Householder, how does the Tathāgata, who is the knower of the world,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas mi dge pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji ltar ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas mi dge pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji ltar ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: the knower of the suchlike, the knower of the world and beings, the unsurpassed guide who tames beings, the teacher of gods and humans, the enlightened one, the blessed buddha, know and see the world?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas mi dge ba'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas mi dge ba'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Householder, here the Tathāgata knows and sees as it is the world’s arising.🔽“Householder, the Tathāgata, who is the knower of the world, the knower of the suchlike, the knower of the world and beings, the unsurpassed guide who tames beings, the teacher of gods and humans, the enlightened one, the blessed buddha, knows and sees as it is the world’s cessation.

original: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata, who is the knower of the world, the knower of the suchlike, the knower of the world and beings, the unsurpassed guide who tames beings, the teacher of gods and humans, the enlightened one, the blessed buddha, know and see the world’s cessation?

original: @85b rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis mi dge ba'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te; gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /

translated: “The causes and conditions by which the knowledge of the origin of the understanding of the unwholesome elements is accomplished are also correctly known as they are.🔽If one abides in the view of impermanence or if one abides in the view of opposition, the Tathāgata knows it as it is.

analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji ltar ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //

translated: the element that is to be practiced correctly, the element that is to be practiced incorrectly, the element that is to be practiced in a timely way, and the element that is to be practiced in a manner that accords with one’s conduct.

analyzed: pa 'di ni /
translated: “The knowledge, seeing, discernment, intuition, and expertise regarding this are called

analyzed: / gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas gal te phyir rgol par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar 'di ni /

analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa zhes bya ste /

translated: If one were to ask, ‘Why is that?’, the Tathāgata would answer for an eon, or for even more than an eon.

analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /

analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don byas shing don ma yin pa bzlog la /

original: snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal te /
analyzed: snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal te /

analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa ste /

analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: The knowledge and vision of this up to the expertise is

translated: the cessation of the knowledge of the unfixed element.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lung du ma bstan pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lung du ma bstan pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: If someone were to ask the Tathāgata about this cessation of the knowledge of the unfixed element, he would answer for an eon, or even longer than an eon.

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and the mansion.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar @88a *//
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar @88a *//
translated: Householder, how is it

original: na; de bzhin gshegs pas lung du ma bstan pa'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /🔽khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa shes pa gang gis lung du ma bstan pa'i khams shes pa yongs su shes /🔽khong du chud /
analyzed: na; de bzhin gshegs pas lung du ma bstan pa'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na / khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa shes pa gang gis lung du ma bstan pa'i khams shes pa yongs su shes / khong du chud /

analyzed: mngon sum du byas pa'i 'gog pa de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te / gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am / gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: “Householder, here the Tathāgata, with knowledge, understands as it really is the cessation of the knowledge of the element that is indeterminate, which he has fully understood and realized for himself.🔽If he abides watching for the absence of gratification in the indeterminate element,🔽if he abides watching for the danger in the indeterminate element,

original: gal te nges par 'byung bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gal te nges par 'byung bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'o //

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lung du ma bstan pa'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /

translated: “Householder, when asked, ‘What is the path to the cessation of the knowledge of the unindicated element of the Tathāgata?’ he would answer after a fortnight, and so on as before.

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na; khyim bdag /
translated: Householder, how does the Tathāgata know the knowledge of the element with outflows as it really is?

analyzed: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'dod pa'i zag pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'i khams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Householder, here the Tathāgata knows the element that is associated with the outflows of desire as it really is.

original: srid @88b pa'i zag pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'i khams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: srid @88b pa'i zag pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'i khams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
translated: He knows the element that is associated with the outflows of existence as it really is.

original: lta ba'i zag pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'i khams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: lta ba'i zag pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'i khams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
translated: He knows the realm that is associated with the defilement of views just as it really is.

original: ma rig pa'i zag pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'i khams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i zag pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'i khams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the realm that is associated with the defilement of ignorance just as it really is.🔽The knowledge,🔽seeing, clarity, realization,

original: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: understanding, and expertise that is in regard to that is called

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: ‘the knowledge of the realm with defilements.’

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata has the utmost knowledge of that.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: If one were to ask the Tathāgata about this knowledge of the realm with defilements, he could explain it for an eon or for the remainder of an eon.

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: He would enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and this fine house.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: Householder, how is it🔽that the Tathāgata has the utmost knowledge of the realm without defilements?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “How does the Tathāgata, who is the knower of the arising of the knowledge of the contaminated realm, know it as it really is?

analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag @89a *//
translated: “Householder, here the Tathāgata knows thus:

analyzed: par 'grub pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Having planted the roots of virtue with immeasurable buddha bhagavāns, the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the contaminated realm is accomplished.

original: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata knows thus:
