translated: The causes and conditions by which the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the contaminated realm is accomplished, those causes and conditions he knows as they really are.

original: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas de bzhin du sbyar te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas de bzhin du sbyar te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata has understood as it really is the abiding in the observation of impermanence, and in the same way, the abiding in the observation of the adversary, up to the observation of the escape.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: If one were to ask him a question about that, the Tathāgata would answer it, and he would continue to answer correctly for an eon, or the remainder of an eon.

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: He will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and this mansion.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: Householder, how does the Tathāgata, Worthy and Perfectly Awakened One, understand as it really is the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the realm with contaminants?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, here the Tathāgata has understood as it really is:

original: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don byas shing don ma yin pa bzlog la /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don byas shing don ma yin pa bzlog la /
translated: having done what is to be done for countless sentient beings, having turned away what is not to be done,

original: snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal te sems @89b can dpag tu med pa rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas nas bde ba la btsud pa ni /
analyzed: snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal te sems @89b can dpag tu med pa rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas nas bde ba la btsud pa ni /
translated: He has dispelled darkness and brought freedom from suffering to countless beings, establishing them in happiness.🔽“The knowledge of the cessation of the realm with contaminants

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa ste /🔽de'ang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i chos can no //🔽de la shes pa dang / mthong ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa ste / de'ang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i chos can no // de la shes pa dang / mthong ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: is the knowledge of the cessation of the realm with contaminants.🔽It is the knowledge of the cessation of the realm with contaminants.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa zhes bya ste /🔽de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa zhes bya ste / de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: The knowledge of the cessation of the realm with contaminants is the knowledge of the cessation of the realm with contaminants.🔽The Tathāgata has understood as it really is the knowledge of the cessation of the realm with contaminants.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, having understood as it really is the knowledge of the cessation of the realm with contaminants, explains, teaches, proclaims, establishes, reveals, analyzes, and elucidates it.

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and the mansion.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: Householder, how is it that

original: de bzhin gshegs pas zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “How does the Tathāgata know as it really is the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the element that is subject to defilement?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa shes pa gang gis zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa yongs su shes; khong du chud /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa shes pa gang gis zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa yongs su shes; khong du chud /
translated: “Householder, here the Tathāgata knows as it really is, through some knowledge, the cessation of the knowledge of the element that is subject to defilement.

original: mngon sum du byas pa'i 'gog pa shes pa de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: mngon sum du byas pa'i 'gog pa shes pa de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He knows as it really is the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the element that is subject to defilement.

original: gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar @90a *//
analyzed: gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar @90a *//
translated: If he abides contemplating the undesirability of the element that is subject to defilement,🔽if he abides contemplating the disadvantages of the element that is subject to defilement,

original: gnas pa'am / gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gnas pa'am / gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: if he abides contemplating the abandonment of the element that is subject to defilement,

original: gal te nges par 'byung bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i shes pa de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gal te nges par 'byung bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i shes pa de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: “How does the Tathāgata know as it really is the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the element that is subject to defilement?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: When asked about the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the realm of the tathāgatas with outflows, he would answer for an eon, and so on.

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and the mansion.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: Householder, how

original: de bzhin gshegs pas zag pa med pa'i khams shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas zag pa med pa'i khams shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: does the Tathāgata know the realm without outflows just as it is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'dod pa'i zag pa dang mi ldan pa'i khams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'dod pa'i zag pa dang mi ldan pa'i khams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, here the Tathāgata knows just as it is the realm that is not associated with the outflows of desire,

original: srid pa'i zag pa dang / lta ba'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa dang mi ldan pa'i khams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: srid pa'i zag pa dang / lta ba'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa dang mi ldan pa'i khams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the realm that is not associated with the outflows of existence, the outflows of views, and the outflows of ignorance.

original: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: The knowledge, seeing, illumination, up to the skill regarding that which is from consciousness up to the element of skill is

original: zag pa med pa'i khams shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i khams shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: called the knowledge of the uncontaminated element.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata has perfectly realized the knowledge of the uncontaminated element.

original: de bzhin @90b gshegs pa zag pa med pa'i khams shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin @90b gshegs pa zag pa med pa'i khams shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: If one were to ask about the knowledge of the uncontaminated element of the Tathāgata, the answer would be spoken for an eon, and similarly,

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: one would enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and the fine mansion.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas zag pa med pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas zag pa med pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata, who is the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the uncontaminated element, know it as it really is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, the Tathāgata has perfectly realized

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas zag pa med pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas zag pa med pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Having generated the roots of virtue in the presence of immeasurable Buddha Bhagavats, the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the uncontaminated element is accomplished. The Tathāgata knows just as it is:

original: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Moreover, the Tathāgata knows thus:

original: rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis zag pa med pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis zag pa med pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: The causes and conditions by which the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the uncontaminated element is accomplished, those causes and conditions he knows just as they are:

original: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: whether one abides in the observation of impermanence or whether one abides in the observation of opposition, the Tathāgata knows just as it is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zag pa med pa'i khams @91a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zag pa med pa'i khams @91a *//
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, knows the uncontaminated element,

original: shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: If someone were to ask you about the knowledge of the arising of consciousness, you could answer for an eon without exhausting the topic.🔽And so on up to:

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: “Householder, you will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and this fine house.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pas zag pa med pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas zag pa med pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata, who has knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the element of the deathless, know the cessation of the knowledge of the element of the deathless?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, here the Tathāgata knows as it really is:

original: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don byas shing don ma yin pa bzlog la /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don byas shing don ma yin pa bzlog la /
translated: ‘Having done what was beneficial and avoided what was not beneficial,

original: snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal te sems can dpag tu med pa rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas nas bde ba la btsud pa ni /
analyzed: snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal te sems can dpag tu med pa rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas nas bde ba la btsud pa ni /
translated: having given light, having removed darkness, having given light to countless beings, having freed countless beings from their sufferings, having brought countless beings to happiness,

original: zag pa med pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa ste /
translated: I have stopped the knowledge of the element of the deathless.

original: de'ang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: de'ang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i chos can no //
translated: And that is a quality that has not arisen from the beginning.’

original: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: The knowledge, seeing, cognition, discernment, and expertise that is related to this is

original: zag pa med pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: called the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the untainted element.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata has perfect knowledge of this.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zag pa med pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zag pa med pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: If someone were to ask the Tathāgata a question about this knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the untainted element, he would answer for an eon and more.

original: @91b de ni; tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: @91b de ni; tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: He would enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and palace.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas zag pa med pa'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas zag pa med pa'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: Householder, how does the Tathāgata have right and perfect knowledge of the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the untainted element?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa shes pa gang gis zag pa med pa'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yongs su shes /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa shes pa gang gis zag pa med pa'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yongs su shes /
translated: Householder, the Tathāgata has fully understood the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the uncontaminated element, by means of which knowledge the cessation of the knowledge of the uncontaminated element is known.

original: khong du chud /
analyzed: khong du chud /
translated: He has understood, penetrated, and realized with direct knowledge that cessation of knowledge, which, if one dwells contemplating gratification, would lead to the arising of unarisen sensual desire and increase of arisen sensual desire, and if one dwells contemplating danger, would lead to the arising of unarisen ill will and increase of arisen ill will, and if one dwells contemplating escape, would lead to the arising of unarisen sloth and torpor and increase of arisen sloth and torpor.

original: mngon sum du byas pa'i 'gog pa gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /🔽gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /🔽gal te nges par 'byung bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i shes pa de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa zag pa med pa'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: mngon sum du byas pa'i 'gog pa gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am / gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am / gal te nges par 'byung bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i shes pa de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to // de bzhin gshegs pa zag pa med pa'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: He has understood, penetrated, and realized with direct knowledge that cessation of knowledge, which, if one dwells contemplating gratification, would lead to the arising of unarisen restlessness and remorse and increase of arisen restlessness and remorse, and if one dwells contemplating danger, would lead to the arising of unarisen doubt and increase of arisen doubt.🔽He has understood, penetrated, and realized with direct knowledge that cessation of knowledge, which, if one dwells contemplating gratification, would lead to the arising of unarisen doubt and increase of arisen doubt, and if one dwells contemplating danger, would lead to the arising of unarisen restlessness and remorse and increase of arisen restlessness and remorse, and if one dwells contemplating escape, would lead to the arising of unarisen sloth and torpor and increase of arisen sloth and torpor.🔽He has understood, penetrated, and realized with direct knowledge that cessation of knowledge, which, if one dwells contemplating gratification, would lead to the arising of unarisen sloth and torpor and increase of arisen sloth and torpor, and if one dwells contemplating danger, would lead to the arising of unarisen restlessness and remorse and increase of arisen restlessness and remorse, and if one dwells contemplating escape, would lead to the arising of unarisen doubt and increase of arisen doubt.

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: He has understood, penetrated, and realized with direct knowledge that cessation of knowledge, which, if one dwells contemplating gratification, would lead to the arising of unarisen doubt and increase of arisen doubt, and if one dwells contemplating danger, would lead to the arising of unarisen sloth and torpor and increase of arisen sloth and torpor, and if one dwells contemplating escape, would lead to the arising of unarisen restlessness and remorse and increase of arisen restlessness

original: de bzhin gshegs pas zang zing dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /🔽khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang yang @92a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas zang zing dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na / khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang yang @92a *//
translated: “How does the Tathāgata know as it really is the element with relishing?”

original: dag par ldan pa'i khams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //🔽de la shes pa dang / mthong ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: dag par ldan pa'i khams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to // de la shes pa dang / mthong ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: “Householder, here the Tathāgata knows as it really is the element endowed with the five sensual pleasures.

original: zang zing dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa shes bya ste /
analyzed: zang zing dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa shes bya ste /
translated: “The knowledge, the vision, up to the discernment of that is the knowledge of the element with relishing.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: That the Tathāgata knows as it really is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zang zing dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zang zing dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: And if that knowledge of the element with relishing were to be asked about, the Tathāgata would answer for an eon or what is left of the eon.

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: He would enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and the mansion.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata know as it really is the element without relishing?”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zang zing dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zang zing dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “How does the Tathāgata know the knowledge of the arising of the element with materiality as it really is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, here the Tathāgata knows:🔽‘Having planted wholesome roots with immeasurable lord buddhas, the knowledge of the arising of the element with materiality is accomplished.’

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas zang zing dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to🔽// khyim bdag /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas zang zing dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to // khyim bdag /
translated: The Tathāgata knows this as it really is.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis zang zing dang bcas pa'i khams @92b shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag bar 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis zang zing dang bcas pa'i khams @92b shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag bar 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Moreover, householder, the Tathāgata knows as it really is the cause and the reason why the knowledge of the arising of the element with materiality is accomplished.

original: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar du'o //
translated: He abides observing impermanence, and so on, up to: he abides observing the adversary.🔽“If someone were to ask you, ‘Householder, where will the Tathāgata go when he has passed away?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zang zing dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zang zing dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: ’ you should answer him, ‘Householder, the Tathāgata has declared that the arising of the world is due to ignorance and craving for existence.

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: Therefore, householder, the Tathāgata will go to the place where ignorance and craving for existence are extinguished.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas zang zing dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas zang zing dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: ’ “Householder, how does the Tathāgata, who has understood the cessation of the element of the sensual medium, understand it?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, the Tathāgata has understood this:

original: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don byas shing don ma yin pa bzlog la /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don byas shing don ma yin pa bzlog la /
translated: he has done good for immeasurable beings and turned them away from evil.

original: snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal te sems can dpag tu med pa rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas nas bde ba la btsud pa ni /
analyzed: snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal te sems can dpag tu med pa rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas nas bde ba la btsud pa ni /
translated: He has dispelled darkness and brought immeasurable beings to complete liberation from suffering and established them in happiness.

original: zang zing dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa ste /
analyzed: zang zing dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa ste /
translated: “The knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the element with materiality is as follows:

original: de'ang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: de'ang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i chos can no //
translated: It is unborn from the very beginning.🔽“The knowledge, seeing, clarity, realization,

original: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag @93a *//🔽par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag @93a *// par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: perfect understanding, and expertise regarding this are

original: zang zing dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zang zing dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: called ‘the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the element with materiality.’

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata has perfect knowledge of this as it is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zang zing dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zang zing dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: If someone were to ask the Tathāgata about this knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the element with materiality, he could answer for an eon, or for an eon minus one instant.

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pas zang zing dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /

translated: He will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and the mansion.🔽Householder, how does the Tathāgata know as it really is the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the element with sustenance?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa shes pa gang gis zang zing dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yongs su shes /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa shes pa gang gis zang zing dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yongs su shes /
translated: Householder, in this case, the Tathāgata, with knowledge, fully knows the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the element with sustenance.

original: khong du chud /
analyzed: khong du chud /
translated: He understands it,🔽he realizes it, he has a direct experience of it.

original: mngon sum du byas pa'i 'gog pa shes pa de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /🔽gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /

translated: He knows that cessation as it really is.🔽If he abides observing the enjoyment of the element with sustenance,

original: gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: if he abides observing the danger in the element with sustenance,

original: gal te nges bar 'byung bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i shes pa de @93b yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gal te nges bar 'byung bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i shes pa de @93b yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata fully knows the consciousness that abides in the observation of definite release just as it is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zang zing dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zang zing dang bcas pa'i khams shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: “Householder, when asked, ‘How does the Tathāgata know the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the element with materiality? ’ he would answer for an eon and so on as before.

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na; de bzhin gshegs pas zang zing med pa'i khams shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na; de bzhin gshegs pas zang zing med pa'i khams shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: He will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and the mansion.🔽“Householder, how does the Tathāgata know the knowledge of the element without materiality just as it is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dag dang mi ldan pa'i zang zing med pa'i khams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dag dang mi ldan pa'i zang zing med pa'i khams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: “Householder, here the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the element without materiality is the knowledge of the element without materiality that is not associated with the five sense pleasures just as it is.

original: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: “The knowledge, seeing, cognition, realization, and understanding of that are

original: zang zing med pa'i khams shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zang zing med pa'i khams shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: called the knowledge of the element without contaminants.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata has perfect knowledge of that element without contaminants just as it is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zang zing med pa'i khams shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zang zing med pa'i khams shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: If someone were to ask you, ‘Why is that element without contaminants called the element without contaminants?’

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pas zang zing med pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba @94a *//
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na / de bzhin gshegs pas zang zing med pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba @94a *//
translated: you should answer them as follows: ‘It is the element without contaminants because it is not subject to destruction.’🔽“Householder, how does the Tathāgata have the knowledge of the arising of the element without contaminants?

original: bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: Householder, the Tathāgata has perfect knowledge of the arising of the element without contaminants as it really is.

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, the Tathāgata has perfect knowledge of the arising of the element without contaminants as it really is.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas zang zing med pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas zang zing med pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Having planted wholesome roots with immeasurable Buddha Bhagavāns, the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the element without conflict is accomplished. The Tathāgata knows it as it really is.

original: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Moreover, the Tathāgata knows in this way:

analyzed: rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis zang zing med pa'i khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: The causes and conditions by which the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the element without conflict is accomplished, those causes and conditions he knows as they really are.

original: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: If one abides in the observation of impermanence, up to if one abides in the observation of opposition, the Tathāgata knows that as it really is.

translated: he would answer for an eon and so on, up to

analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas zang zing med pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag @94b pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata know as it really is the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the element of no-grasping?

analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata has understood this:🔽having benefited infinite sentient beings, having turned them away from what is not beneficial, and so on up to

analyzed: de'ang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i chos can no; ;de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /

translated: If someone were to ask the Tathāgata a question about the knowledge of the element that is without conflict, he would answer it for a whole eon, and he would also do likewise🔽and so on up to

analyzed: pa gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /

analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /

analyzed: 'phags pa'i khams shes pa zhes bya ste /

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //

translated: ’ they would answer, ‘It is the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the cessation of suffering.

original: ji ltar na /
analyzed: ji ltar na /
translated: ’ If they were to ask, ‘What is the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering?🔽’ they would answer, ‘It is the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering.🔽’ “Householder, if someone were to ask, ‘What is the noble element of knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering?🔽’ they would answer, ‘It is the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering.🔽’ If they were to ask, ‘What is the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the cessation of suffering?🔽’ they would answer, ‘It is the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the cessation of suffering.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'phags pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /🔽khyim bdag / @96a *//

analyzed: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /

translated: ’ If they were to ask, ‘What is the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the noble truths?

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'phags pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de ni /
translated: If one were to ask questions about the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the āryas’ element for eons equal to the number of grains of sand in the Ganges, his answers would continue without interruption.

translated: “The knowledge, up to the expertise, regarding this is called

translated: “Householder, how is it

translated: ‘The causes and conditions by which the knowledge of the arising of the non-ārya realm is accomplished—those causes and conditions are known as they really are.🔽“

original: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //

translated: The Tathāgata has understood as it really is the abiding in the observation of impermanence, up to the abiding in the observation of the adversary.

translated: “Householder, when asked, ‘How does the Tathāgata, who has understood as it really is the arising of the knowledge of the noble and ignoble elements, answer?’, he answers for an eon, up to ‘He will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and palace.’

analyzed: khyim bdag 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata has understood as it really is

original: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don byas shing don ma yin pa bzlog la /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don byas shing don ma yin pa bzlog la /
translated: having benefited immeasurable sentient beings and turned them away from what is not beneficial.

original: snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal te sems can dpag tu med pa rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas nas bde ba la btsud pa ni 'phags pa ma yin pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa ste /

translated: Having made light and dispelled darkness, he has completely liberated and brought to bliss countless sentient beings from suffering. This is the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the non-ārya realm.

analyzed: de'ang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i chos can no //
translated: Moreover, it is a dharma that has been unborn from the beginning.

analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni 'phags pa ma yin pa'i khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The knowledge, seeing, illumination, clear understanding, thorough comprehension, and expertise regarding this is called the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the non-ārya realm.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata fully knows this as it truly is.

translated: the Tathāgata knows the mundane knowledge as it really is.

translated: If you ask the Tathāgata about that mundane knowledge, he would answer for an eon, and you would still not finish asking your questions.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /

original: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te; rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis 'jig rten pa'i shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyud dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji ltar bzhin @99a *//
analyzed: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te; rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis 'jig rten pa'i shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyud dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji ltar bzhin @99a *//
translated: “Moreover, the Tathāgata, through the purity of his divine eye, sees the world with its beings, with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its religious wanderers and Brahmins, gods and humans, all passing away and being reborn, inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, in happy and unhappy destinies, all of them passing away and being reborn according to their actions.🔽“Moreover, the Tathāgata, through the purity of his divine eye, sees the passing away and rebirth of beings, and he knows the inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, happy and unhappy destinies into which they are reborn according to their actions.

original: rab tu mkhyen te /🔽gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: rab tu mkhyen te / gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: “Moreover, the Tathāgata, through the destruction of the taints, in this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, in this generation with its religious wanderers and Brahmins, gods and humans, by his own superknowledge with direct knowledge, having attained it, dwells in it.🔽“Moreover, the Tathāgata, through the destruction of the taints, in this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, in this generation with its religious wanderers and Brahmins, gods and humans, by his own superknowledge with direct knowledge, having attained it, dwells in it.🔽“Moreover, the Tathāgata, through the destruction of the taints, in this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, in this generation with its religious wanderers and Brahmins, gods and humans, by his own superknowledge with direct knowledge, having attained it, dwells in it.

original: gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: “Moreover, the Tathāgata, through the destruction of the taints, in this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, in this generation with its religious wanderers and Brahmins, gods and humans, by his own superknowledge with direct knowledge, having attained it, dwells in it.

translated: Having planted the roots of virtue with immeasurable Buddha Bhagavāns, the knowledge of the arising of the transcendent element is accomplished. The Tathāgata thoroughly knows that just as it is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'dus byas kyi khams shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'dus byas kyi khams shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata know the knowledge of the conditioned element just as it is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: “Householder, here the Tathāgata knows the five appropriated aggregates just as they are.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'dus byas kyi khams shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'dus byas kyi khams shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de ni /
translated: If someone were to ask the Tathāgata about the knowledge of the element of the conditioned, he would answer for an eon,

original: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: and he would enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and palace.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'dus byas kyi khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'dus byas kyi khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata know the knowledge of the arising of the element of the conditioned as it really is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata has understood this:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas 'dus byas kyi khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas 'dus byas kyi khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: ‘Having planted wholesome roots with immeasurable lord buddhas, the knowledge of the arising of the element of the conditioned is accomplished.’ The Tathāgata has understood this as it really is.

original: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Furthermore, the Tathāgata has understood this:

original: rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis 'dus byas kyi khams @102a *//
analyzed: rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis 'dus byas kyi khams @102a *//
translated: What are the causes and conditions🔽for the arising of the knowledge of the arising of the elements of the conditioned?

original: shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /🔽gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to; ;de bzhin gshegs pa 'dus byas kyi khams shes pa kun
analyzed: shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te / gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to; ;de bzhin gshegs pa 'dus byas kyi khams shes pa kun
translated: The Tathāgata knows perfectly the causes and conditions for the arising of the knowledge of the arising of the elements of the conditioned.🔽If one abides in the contemplation of impermanence, up to if one abides in the contemplation of opposition, the Tathāgata knows perfectly as it really is.🔽The Tathāgata, in regard to that knowledge of the arising of the elements of the conditioned,

original: 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de ni /
analyzed: 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de ni /
translated: if questioned, would give an answer for an eon, or half an eon.

original: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and palace.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: Householder, how

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'dus byas kyi khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'dus byas kyi khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “How does the Tathāgata know the cessation of the knowledge of the conditioned realm as it really is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, here the Tathāgata knows thus:

original: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don byas shing don ma yin pa bzlog la /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don byas shing don ma yin pa bzlog la /
translated: Having acted for the welfare of innumerable sentient beings and turned them away from what is not welfare,

original: snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal te sems can dpag tu med pa rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas nas bde ba la btsud pa ni /
analyzed: snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal te sems can dpag tu med pa rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas nas bde ba la btsud pa ni /
translated: having given light and dispelled darkness, having liberated innumerable sentient beings from suffering and established them in happiness,

original: 'dus byas kyi khams shes pa 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi khams shes pa 'gog pa ste /
translated: the cessation of the knowledge of the conditioned realm

original: de'ang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: de'ang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i chos can no //
translated: is from the beginning a dharma that is unborn.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba @102b bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba @102b bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata knows that as it really is.

original: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni; 'dus byas kyi khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni; 'dus byas kyi khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The knowledge, seeing, illumination, realization, discernment, and expertise that is the cessation of the knowledge of the conditioned realm is called ‘the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the conditioned realm.’

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te //
translated: The Tathāgata has perfect knowledge of that.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'dus byas kyi khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'dus byas kyi khams shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de ni /
translated: If someone were to ask the Tathāgata a question about the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the conditioned realm, he could answer it in an instant, or in a hundred instants, or a thousand instants, or a hundred thousand instants.

original: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /

analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'dus ma byas kyi khams shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “How does the Tathāgata know the unconditioned realm as it really is?”

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang / nam mkha' dang / mya ngan las 'das pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //

translated: “Householder, here the Tathāgata knows as it really is the cessation through analysis, space, and nirvāṇa.

analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi khams kyi shes pa zhes bya ste /

translated: and he would enjoy using this sandalwood courtyard and mansion.”

analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas 'dus ma byas kyi khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa de de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas 'dus ma byas kyi khams shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa de de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Having generated roots of virtue toward immeasurable buddha bhagavāns, the knowledge of the arising of the unconditioned realm is accomplished. The Tathāgata knows this.

original: khyim bdag gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /

translated: The causes and conditions by which the knowledge of the arising of the unconditioned realm is accomplished, those causes and conditions he knows exactly as they are.

original: gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //

translated: Householder, how does the Tathāgata, who has understood the knowledge of the unconditioned element, know as it really is the knowledge of the path that leads to cessation?
