analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas kun shes pa'i dbang po zhes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: the Tathāgata thoroughly know the knowledge of the arising of the faculty of complete knowing just as it is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis dud shes pa'i dbang po shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis dud shes pa'i dbang po shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa /
translated: Householder, in this case, the Tathāgata thoroughly knows the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the faculty of complete knowing, which is accomplished by what causes and what conditions.

original: gal @138b te mi rtag bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gal @138b te mi rtag bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: If one abides in the observation of impermanence,

original: gal te sdug bsngal bar rjes su de lta bar gnas pa nas de bzhin du sbyar te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar gyi rgyud dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa kun shes pa'i dbang po shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung zhing bskal pa brgya nas bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal bar rjes su de lta bar gnas pa nas de bzhin du sbyar te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar gyi rgyud dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to // de bzhin gshegs pa kun shes pa'i dbang po shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung zhing bskal pa brgya nas bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu lan gsung ste /
translated: If it is asked how the Tathāgata knows the arising of the knowledge of the faculty of understanding suffering, in the same way, he knows the arising of the knowledge of the faculty of understanding the origin of suffering, the faculty of understanding the cessation of suffering, and the faculty of understanding the path that leads to the cessation of suffering.🔽“If someone were to ask the Tathāgata about the arising of the knowledge of the faculty of understanding, he could answer for an eon or for a hundred eons, or for a thousand eons, or for a hundred thousand eons, or for an asaṃkhyeya number of eons.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same way, he could answer for two, three, four, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, or a hundred eons.

original: de ni; tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: de ni; tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: He will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and the mansion.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pas kun shes pa'i dbang po shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas kun shes pa'i dbang po shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata know as it really is the knowledge of the cessation of the faculty of understanding?”

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata thoroughly knows this:

original: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don byas shing don ma yin pa bzlog la /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don byas shing don ma yin pa bzlog la /
translated: He has acted for the welfare of countless sentient beings and turned them away from what is not welfare.

original: snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal te sems can dpag tu med pa rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas nas bde ba la btsud pa ni /
analyzed: snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal te sems can dpag tu med pa rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas nas bde ba la btsud pa ni /
translated: He has created light and dispelled darkness, and he has liberated countless sentient beings from suffering and brought them to happiness.

original: kun shes pa'i dbang po shes pa 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: kun shes pa'i dbang po shes pa 'gog pa ste /
translated: The cessation of the knowledge of the faculty of final and complete knowledge

original: de'ang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: de'ang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i chos can no //
translated: is also a nonarisen dharma from the beginning.🔽“Householder, the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the faculty of final and complete knowledge

original: de la @139a *//
analyzed: de la @139a *//
translated: is this:

original: shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: Whatever it is, whether knowledge, seeing, clarity, realization, full understanding, or expertise,

original: kun shes pa'i dbang po shes pa 'gog pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: kun shes pa'i dbang po shes pa 'gog pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: it is called the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the faculty of final and complete knowledge.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata thoroughly knows this as it really is.🔽“

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun shes pa'i dbang po shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun shes pa'i dbang po shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de ni /
translated: If asked about the cessation of the knowledge of the faculty of understanding all things, the Tathāgata would answer for an eon, and even longer than an eon.

original: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: Householder, those who remember this Dharma discourse ‘Taught by the Tathāgata’ will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and the fine mansion.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun shes pa'i dbang po shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun shes pa'i dbang po shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: Householder, how does the Tathāgata know the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the faculty of understanding all things, as it really is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis kun shes pa'i dbang po shes pa yongs su shes /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis kun shes pa'i dbang po shes pa yongs su shes /
translated: Householder, in this regard, the Tathāgata knows the cause and the condition by which the knowledge of the faculty of understanding all things is understood,

original: khong du chud /🔽mngon sum du byas pa'i 'gog pa gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: khong du chud / mngon sum du byas pa'i 'gog pa gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: penetrated,🔽and actualized. If the cessation of that knowledge is the absence of relishing, he knows it.🔽If the cessation of that knowledge is the absence of relishing, he knows it.🔽If the cessation of that knowledge is the absence of relishing, he knows it.🔽If the cessation of that knowledge is the absence of relishing, he knows it.🔽If the cessation of that knowledge is the absence of relishing, he knows it.🔽If the cessation of that knowledge is the absence of relishing, he knows it.🔽If the cessation of that knowledge is the absence of relishing, he knows it.🔽If the cessation of that knowledge is the absence of relishing, he knows it.🔽If the cessation of that knowledge is the absence of relishing, he knows it.🔽If the cessation of that knowledge is the absence of relishing, he knows it.🔽If the cessation of that knowledge is the absence of relishing, he knows it.🔽If the cessation of that knowledge is the absence of relishing, he knows it.🔽If the cessation of that knowledge is the absence of relishing, he knows it.🔽If the cessation of that knowledge is the absence of relishing, he knows it.🔽If the cessation of that knowledge is the absence of relishing, he knows it.🔽If the cessation of that knowledge is the absence of relishing, he knows it.🔽If the cessation of that knowledge is the absence of relishing, he knows it.🔽If the cessation of that knowledge is the absence of relishing, he knows it.🔽If the cessation of that knowledge is the absence of relishing, he knows it.🔽If the cessation of that knowledge is the absence of relishing, he knows it.

original: gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: If the cessation of that knowledge is the absence

original: gal te nges par 'byung bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin @139b rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gal te nges par 'byung bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin @139b rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: If they abide in the view of definite emergence, the Tathāgata fully knows that just as it is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun shes pa'i dbang po shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun shes pa'i dbang po shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: If they ask about the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the faculty of understanding, he would answer for an eon, and so on as before.

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: He would enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and palace.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: Householder, how is it that

original: de bzhin gshegs pas kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: the Tathāgata knows the knowledge of the faculty of understanding just as it is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten du nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi mdzad pa dag mdzad pas dad pa dang /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten du nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi mdzad pa dag mdzad pas dad pa dang /
translated: “Householder, here the Tathāgata, through his deeds in the world of the ten directions, knows exactly the faith,

original: brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the effort, the mindfulness, the concentration, and the wisdom of the śrāvakas, the pratyekabuddhas, and the tathāgatas who have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: The knowledge, seeing, clarity, and realization of that, up to the skill,

original: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //🔽khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas rgyun du zhugs pa'i kun tu sbyor ba gsum spangs pa la bya ba ci'ang med do //
analyzed: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o // khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas rgyun du zhugs pa'i kun tu sbyor ba gsum spangs pa la bya ba ci'ang med do //
translated: is called the faculty of possessing complete knowledge.🔽“Moreover, householder, the Tathāgata knows exactly that for stream enterers who have abandoned the three fetters there is nothing to be done.

original: zhes rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: zhes rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: “Moreover, householder, the Tathāgata knows exactly that for once-returners who have greatly reduced attachment and hatred there is nothing to be done.🔽“Moreover, householder, the Tathāgata knows exactly that for nonreturners who have abandoned five or six of the defilements there is nothing to be done.🔽“Moreover, householder, the Tathāgata knows exactly that for arhats who have abandoned the five lower fetters there is nothing to be done.🔽“Moreover, householder, the Tathāgata knows exactly that for pratyekabuddhas who have abandoned the five lower fetters and the five higher fetters there is nothing to be done.🔽“Moreover, householder, the Tathāgata knows exactly that for tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas who have abandoned the ten defilements there is nothing to be done.

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i @140a *//🔽'dod chags dang gnod sems bsrabs pa la bya ba ci'ang med do //
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i @140a *// 'dod chags dang gnod sems bsrabs pa la bya ba ci'ang med do //
translated: “The once-returner

original: zhes rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: zhes rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: has reduced attachment and aversion to nothing at all.”🔽“The non-returner

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i kun tu sbyor ba tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga dag spangs pa la bya ba ci'ang med do //🔽zhes rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i kun tu sbyor ba tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga dag spangs pa la bya ba ci'ang med do // zhes rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: has abandoned the five lower fetters to nothing at all.”🔽“The arhat

original: dgra bcom pa'i kun tu sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa la bya ba ci'ang med de //🔽zhes rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i kun tu sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa la bya ba ci'ang med de // zhes rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: has abandoned all the fetters to nothing at all.”

original: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata also knows thus:

original: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po ni byas pa so sor rtogs shing mi skye ba so sor rtogs pa rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po ni byas pa so sor rtogs shing mi skye ba so sor rtogs pa rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: ‘The faculty of perfect knowledge is the realization of what is done and the realization of non-arising.’

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: If one were to ask the Tathāgata about this knowledge of the faculty of perfect knowledge, he would answer for an eon and beyond.

original: longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: and the enjoyment of the Dharma.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The origin of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the path are as they have been taught.

original: ston pa mig dang ldan pas byas pa nad 'drar mkhyen //
analyzed: ston pa mig dang ldan pas byas pa nad 'drar mkhyen //
translated: The Teacher, endowed with eyes, knows it to be like a disease.

original: nyon mongs thams cad spangs pas de yi bslab bya med //
analyzed: nyon mongs thams cad spangs pas de yi bslab bya med //
translated: Since all afflictions are abandoned, there is no training in that.

original: bslab pa kun la bslabs pas de yi bslab bya med //
analyzed: bslab pa kun la bslabs pas de yi bslab bya med //
translated: Since one has trained in all trainings, there is no training in that.

original: bya ba byas pa des mkhyen 'di ltar rmongs pa med //
analyzed: bya ba byas pa des mkhyen 'di ltar rmongs pa med //
translated: The one who has done what was to be done knows thus, without confusion.

original: sbrul gyi mche ba bcad cing dug kun rnam bcom pas //
analyzed: sbrul gyi mche ba bcad cing dug kun rnam bcom pas //
translated: Having cut the fangs of the snake and destroyed all poison,

original: sems can gnod byar mi rung dug so dngos med pa //
analyzed: sems can gnod byar mi rung dug so dngos med pa //
translated: it is no longer able to harm beings, its fangs and poison gone.

original: de ltar nyon mongs spangs pa rlom sems mi dmigs te //
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs spangs pa rlom sems mi dmigs te //
translated: In the same way, the one who has abandoned afflictions does not observe conceit.

original: shin tu @140b sgrom bu sbas pa'i sos gzugs mi rung ba //
analyzed: shin tu @140b sgrom bu sbas pa'i sos gzugs mi rung ba //
translated: It is not suitable for the one with well-hidden form.

original: de yi sdig mthong sems can khyad par med pa ltar //
analyzed: de yi sdig mthong sems can khyad par med pa ltar //
translated: Just as one sees sin and is indifferent to beings,

original: de ltar nyon mongs pa dag spangs shing 'das pa med //
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs pa dag spangs shing 'das pa med //
translated: in the same way, afflictions are abandoned without remainder.

original: sngon gyi las mngon 'du byed sdug bsngal 'khor lo sdig /
analyzed: sngon gyi las mngon 'du byed sdug bsngal 'khor lo sdig /
translated: The wheel of suffering of past manifest karma

original: gang gis tshe gzhan dag tu phyir zhing sdug bsngal bzlog /
analyzed: gang gis tshe gzhan dag tu phyir zhing sdug bsngal bzlog /
translated: How can one turn away from suffering in other lives?

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: Householder, how is it that

original: de bzhin gshegs pas dbang po shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas dbang po shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the Tathāgata knows the faculties of others as they really are?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dbang po shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas de ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dbang po shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas de ni /
translated: If he were to be asked about the knowledge of the faculties of others, he would answer for an eon, or even more than an eon.

original: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: He would enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and palace.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: Householder, how is it that

original: de bzhin gshegs pas stobs shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na; khyim bdag /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas stobs shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na; khyim bdag /
translated: the Tathāgata knows the strengths of others as they really are?

original: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas sems can rnams kyi stobs dang stobs ma yin pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas sems can rnams kyi stobs dang stobs ma yin pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, in this case the Tathāgata knows the strengths and weaknesses of sentient beings as they really are.

original: gang zag 'di ni; dad pa'i stobs 'di tsam dang ldan /🔽gang zag 'di ni /
analyzed: gang zag 'di ni; dad pa'i stobs 'di tsam dang ldan /🔽gang zag 'di ni /
translated: This person has this much strength of faith.🔽This person has this much strength of wisdom.

original: brtson 'grus kyi stobs 'di tsam dang ldan /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi stobs 'di tsam dang ldan /
translated: This person has this much power of diligence.

original: dran pa'i stobs 'di tsam dang ldan /
analyzed: dran pa'i stobs 'di tsam dang ldan /
translated: This person has this much power of mindfulness.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs 'di tsam dang ldan /🔽gang zag 'di ni /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs 'di tsam dang ldan / gang zag 'di ni /
translated: This person has this much power of samādhi.

original: shes rab kyi stobs 'di tsam dang ldan /🔽gang zag 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi stobs 'di tsam dang ldan / gang zag 'di ni /
translated: This person has this much power of wisdom.

original: thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs 'di tsam dang ldan /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs 'di tsam dang ldan /
translated: This person has this much power of skillful means.

original: gang zag 'di @141a *//🔽ni; mos pa'i stobs 'di tsam dang ldan no //🔽de la shes pa dang / mthong ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: gang zag 'di @141a *// ni; mos pa'i stobs 'di tsam dang ldan no // de la shes pa dang / mthong ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: This person has this much power of aspiration.

original: stobs shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: stobs shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: “The knowledge, seeing, and expertise regarding that is called the knowledge of power.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata has perfect knowledge of that.🔽If one were to ask questions about the Tathāgata’s knowledge of power for an eon, or for even longer than an eon,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa stobs shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /🔽longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa stobs shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te / longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: one would not come to the end of asking questions about the Tathāgata’s knowledge of power.🔽The Tathāgata’s knowledge of power is inconceivable.🔽The Tathāgata’s knowledge of power is beyond the realm of thought.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The Tathāgata’s knowledge of power is beyond the realm of thought.🔽The Tathāgata’s knowledge of power is beyond the realm of thought.🔽The Tathāgata’s knowledge of power is beyond the realm of thought.🔽The Tathāgata’s knowledge of power is beyond the realm of thought.🔽The Tathāgata’s knowledge of power is beyond the realm of thought.🔽The Tathāgata’s knowledge of power is beyond the realm of thought.🔽The Tathāgata’s knowledge of power is beyond the realm of thought.🔽The Tathāgata’s knowledge of power is beyond the realm of thought.🔽The Tathāgata’s knowledge of power is beyond the realm of thought.🔽The Tathāgata’s knowledge of power is beyond the realm of thought.🔽The Tathāgata’s knowledge of power is beyond the realm of thought.🔽The Tathāgata’s knowledge of power is beyond the realm of thought.🔽The Tathāgata’s knowledge of power is beyond the realm of thought.🔽The Tathāgata’s knowledge of power is beyond the realm of thought.🔽The Tathāgata’s knowledge of power is beyond the realm of thought.🔽The Tathāgata’s knowledge of power is beyond the realm of thought.🔽The Tathāgata’s knowledge of power is beyond the realm of thought.🔽The Tathāgata’s knowledge of power is beyond the realm of thought.🔽The Tathāgata’s knowledge

original: 'dir chos nyid 'di la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir chos nyid 'di la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: “This is how we should speak of this dharmatā:

original: bdag nyid chen pos dus ring dag nas stobs shes bsten //
analyzed: bdag nyid chen pos dus ring dag nas stobs shes bsten //
translated: The great being has relied on the power of knowledge for a long time,🔽Has asked countless buddhas without exception,

original: sangs rgyas dpag med dag la ma lus yongs su zhus; ;'jig rten gsal mdzad dbang po stobs dang stobs min gsung //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dpag med dag la ma lus yongs su zhus; ;'jig rten gsal mdzad dbang po stobs dang stobs min gsung //
translated: And has taught the power and nonpower of the lord who illuminates the world.

original: sems can kun gyi shes gang mi mchog rab tu mkhyen //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi shes gang mi mchog rab tu mkhyen //
translated: He knows the knowledge of all beings, the supreme among beings.

original: sems can dag gi dad brtson dran shes shes rab mkhyen //
analyzed: sems can dag gi dad brtson dran shes shes rab mkhyen //
translated: He knows the faith, diligence, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom of beings.

original: gang zhig chos 'di la 'jug 'byor ba ci 'dra ba //
analyzed: gang zhig chos 'di la 'jug 'byor ba ci 'dra ba //
translated: He knows what kind of wealth is engaged in this Dharma.

original: de zhus de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen pas lud ston mdzad //
analyzed: de zhus de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen pas lud ston mdzad //
translated: When asked, the Tathāgata teaches with his knowledge.

original: rdzogs sangs stobs shes de la yang dang yang bslab pas //
analyzed: rdzogs sangs stobs shes de la yang dang yang bslab pas //
translated: The perfect Buddha has trained again and again in that power of knowledge.

original: 'dir ni zhus na de yis thogs med lung ston mdzad //
analyzed: 'dir ni zhus na de yis thogs med lung ston mdzad //
translated: When asked about it here, he gives an unhindered prophecy.

original: rnam 'dren de ni khang mchog 'di la longs spyod @141b 'gyur;/🔽bam po brgyad pa /
analyzed: rnam 'dren de ni khang mchog 'di la longs spyod @141b 'gyur;/ bam po brgyad pa /
translated: That guide will enjoy this supreme mansion.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: Householder, how is it that

original: de bzhin gshegs pas brtson 'grus kyi stobs shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas brtson 'grus kyi stobs shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “How does the Tathāgata know the power of diligence as it really is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, here the Tathāgata knows thus:

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pas don dag 'grus cing /
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pas don dag 'grus cing /
translated: ‘Through the practice of diligence, goals are accomplished,

original: le lo dag gis ni /
analyzed: le lo dag gis ni /
translated: not through laziness.

original: ma yin; brtson 'grus dag brtsams pas gnas shes pa rtogs par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: ma yin; brtson 'grus dag brtsams pas gnas shes pa rtogs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Through the practice of diligence, the knowledge of the abode is realized,

original: le lo dag gis ni /
analyzed: le lo dag gis ni /
translated: not through laziness.

original: ma yin / de bzhin du brtson 'grus dag brtsams pas gnas shes pas kun 'byung ba shes pa rtogs par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: ma yin / de bzhin du brtson 'grus dag brtsams pas gnas shes pas kun 'byung ba shes pa rtogs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: In the same way, through the practice of diligence, the knowledge of the abode that is the knowledge of the origin is realized,

original: le lo dag gis ni /
analyzed: le lo dag gis ni /
translated: not through laziness.

original: ma yin / brtson 'grus dag brtsams pas gnas shes pa rtogs par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: ma yin / brtson 'grus dag brtsams pas gnas shes pa rtogs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Through the practice of diligence, the knowledge of the abode that is the knowledge of the cessation is realized,

original: le lo dag gis ni /
analyzed: le lo dag gis ni /
translated: not through laziness.

original: ma yin / brtson 'grus dag brtsams pas gnas shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa rtogs par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: ma yin / brtson 'grus dag brtsams pas gnas shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa rtogs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Through the practice of diligence, the knowledge of the abode that is the knowledge of the path is realized,

original: le lo dag gis ni /
analyzed: le lo dag gis ni /
translated: not through laziness.

original: ma yin / de bzhin du sbyar te stobs bcu'i bar dag la'ang bya'o //
analyzed: ma yin / de bzhin du sbyar te stobs bcu'i bar dag la'ang bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied up to the ten powers.

original: brtson 'grus dag brtsams pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa rtogs par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: brtson 'grus dag brtsams pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa rtogs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Through the practice of diligence, one will realize the path that leads to the knowledge of an omniscient one.

original: le lo dag gis ni /
analyzed: le lo dag gis ni /
translated: But through laziness,

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: one will not.

original: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /🔽lus dang bags pa rgyus pa rus pa bskams gyur cing //
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ste / lus dang bags pa rgyus pa rus pa bskams gyur cing //
translated: About this, the following is said:🔽“Even if my body, skin, sinews, and bones dry up,🔽and all my blood dries up,

original: @142a *// bdag gi lus dang khrag bcas thams cad yongs bskams kyang //
analyzed: @142a *// bdag gi lus dang khrag bcas thams cad yongs bskams kyang //
translated: I will not stop my diligence

original: thams cad shes pa rtogs par ma byas par du ni //🔽brtson 'grus gtong pa dag tu byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad shes pa rtogs par ma byas par du ni // brtson 'grus gtong pa dag tu byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: until I realize omniscience.”

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pas gnas shes pa rtogs par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pas gnas shes pa rtogs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: through the practice of diligence, one will realize the knowledge of the world.🔽But through laziness,

original: le lo dag gis ma yin te /
analyzed: le lo dag gis ma yin te /
translated: one will not.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pas don dag sgrub par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pas don dag sgrub par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Through the practice of diligence, one will accomplish one’s goals.

original: le lo dag gis ni /
analyzed: le lo dag gis ni /
translated: But through laziness,🔽one will not.

original: ma yin / thams cad mkhyen pa'i shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa'i bar du 'gyur zhing /🔽le lo dag gis ni /
analyzed: ma yin / thams cad mkhyen pa'i shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa'i bar du 'gyur zhing / le lo dag gis ni /
translated: It would be the path of the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of an omniscient one.

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that laziness🔽is the path of the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of an omniscient one.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas brtson 'grus shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas brtson 'grus shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, knows diligence as it really is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa brtson 'grus shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa brtson 'grus shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: If someone were to ask the Tathāgata about this knowledge of diligence, he could answer for an eon or more, and so on up to: he could answer for an eon or more about the knowledge of the path.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: The knowledge of the origination, cessation, and path would be taught in the same way.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas rim pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na; khyim bdag /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas rim pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na; khyim bdag /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, know the knowledge of the stages as it really is?🔽Householder,

original: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas sems can thams cad kyi brtson 'grus kyi rim pa lus kyi dang / sems las byung ba'i brtson 'grus yang @142b dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas sems can thams cad kyi brtson 'grus kyi rim pa lus kyi dang / sems las byung ba'i brtson 'grus yang @142b dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: The Thus-Gone One precisely knows the levels of diligence of all sentient beings, whether it is physical or mental diligence.

original: sems can kha cig lus kyi brtson 'grus dang ldan la /
analyzed: sems can kha cig lus kyi brtson 'grus dang ldan la /
translated: Some sentient beings are endowed with physical diligence,

original: sems las byung bas ni /
analyzed: sems las byung bas ni /
translated: but not with mental diligence.

original: ma yin / sems can kha cig sems las byung ba'i brtson 'grus dang ldan la /🔽lus kyis ni /
analyzed: ma yin / sems can kha cig sems las byung ba'i brtson 'grus dang ldan la / lus kyis ni /
translated: Some sentient beings are endowed with mental diligence,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: but not with physical diligence.

original: de la sems can gang dag brtson 'grus kyi lus dang ldan la /
analyzed: de la sems can gang dag brtson 'grus kyi lus dang ldan la /
translated: Those sentient beings who have physical diligence,

original: sems las byung bas ni /
analyzed: sems las byung bas ni /
translated: but not mental diligence,

original: ma yin pa de; lus nyams chung ba las smod par byed /
analyzed: ma yin pa de; lus nyams chung ba las smod par byed /
translated: will disparage those with weak bodies.

original: lus nyams chung ba las rnam par byang ba med par 'jig cing smod la spro ba mi skyod do //
analyzed: lus nyams chung ba las rnam par byang ba med par 'jig cing smod la spro ba mi skyod do //
translated: They will disparage those with weak bodies, saying that they are not purified and do not progress, and they will not encourage them.

original: gang dag sems las byung ba'i brtson 'grus dang ldan la /
analyzed: gang dag sems las byung ba'i brtson 'grus dang ldan la /
translated: Those who have mental diligence,

original: lus kyis ni ma yin pa de ni /
analyzed: lus kyis ni ma yin pa de ni /
translated: but not physical diligence,

original: sems kyi dbang gis smod par byed cing 'phyar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems kyi dbang gis smod par byed cing 'phyar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They are arrogant and contemptuous because of their minds.

original: gang dag lus kyi dang sems las byung ba'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa de dag ni /
analyzed: gang dag lus kyi dang sems las byung ba'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa de dag ni /
translated: Those who have physical and mental diligence

original: zung du mnyam zhing ldan pa ni /
analyzed: zung du mnyam zhing ldan pa ni /
translated: are balanced and harmonious.

original: smod par mi byed cing 'phyar bar mi byed la /
analyzed: smod par mi byed cing 'phyar bar mi byed la /
translated: They are not contemptuous or arrogant.

original: brtson 'grus bar ma'i shes pa dang ldan pas tshogs sgrub cing bya ba mthar byed la /
analyzed: brtson 'grus bar ma'i shes pa dang ldan pas tshogs sgrub cing bya ba mthar byed la /
translated: They have middling diligence and knowledge, and so they accomplish the accumulations and complete their tasks.

original: bya ba yang dag par sgrub /🔽bdud kyi zhags pa gcod /
analyzed: bya ba yang dag par sgrub / bdud kyi zhags pa gcod /
translated: They accomplish their tasks well.🔽They cut the noose of Māra.

original: bdud pham par byed /🔽bdud phyir phyogs par byed /
analyzed: bdud pham par byed / bdud phyir phyogs par byed /
translated: They defeat Māra.🔽They turn their backs on Māra.

original: bdud kyi ris dag skrag par byed /
analyzed: bdud kyi ris dag skrag par byed /
translated: They frighten the retinue of Māra.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rgyud 'phel bar byed /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rgyud 'phel bar byed /
translated: They increase the lineage of the buddhas.

original: lam sbyong bar byed /🔽mu sten par byed /🔽zam pa 'dogs par byed /
analyzed: lam sbyong bar byed / mu sten par byed / zam pa 'dogs par byed /
translated: They purify the path.🔽They build bridges.

original: stegs 'cha' bar byed /
analyzed: stegs 'cha' bar byed /
translated: They build causeways.

original: ye shes kyi sgron ma 'bar par @143a *//
analyzed: ye shes kyi sgron ma 'bar par @143a *//
translated: They light the lamp of wisdom.

original: byed; snang bar byed /
analyzed: byed; snang bar byed /
translated: They illuminate.

original: mun pa sel bar byed /
analyzed: mun pa sel bar byed /
translated: They dispel darkness.

original: lam ston par byed /
analyzed: lam ston par byed /
translated: They show the path.

original: yang dag par blang ba'i brtson 'grus la shin tu gnas shing yongs su mi nyam par byed do //🔽gang dag lus kyi'am /
analyzed: yang dag par blang ba'i brtson 'grus la shin tu gnas shing yongs su mi nyam par byed do // gang dag lus kyi'am /
translated: He is very well established in the right effort and does not become exhausted.

original: sems las byung ba'i brtson 'grus de dag ni /
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i brtson 'grus de dag ni /
translated: Those who are lazy in body and mind🔽are like the fruit of the kataka tree.

original: shing ka ta ka'i 'bras bu ltar de dag yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shing ka ta ka'i 'bras bu ltar de dag yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: They are exhausted.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas brtson 'grus kyi rim pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas brtson 'grus kyi rim pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the Tathāgata thoroughly knows the stages of effort just as they are and in accordance with reality.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa brtson 'grus kyi rim pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa brtson 'grus kyi rim pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: When asked about this knowledge of the stages of effort of the Tathāgata, he would answer for an eon or longer.

original: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni / tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: He would enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and the fine house.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The origin, cessation, and path are as previously explained.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: Householder, how is it🔽that the Tathāgata thoroughly knows the various kinds of dhātus of sentient beings just as they are and in accordance with reality?

original: de bzhin gshegs pas bsam gtan shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bsam gtan shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “How does the Tathāgata know the knowledge of concentration as it really is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas nyams pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i bsam gtan yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas nyams pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i bsam gtan yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
translated: “Householder, here the Tathāgata knows concentration that is conducive to decline as it really is,

original: gnas pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i bsam gtan yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /🔽khyad par gyi cha dang mthun pa'i bsam gtan @143b yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: gnas pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i bsam gtan yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen / khyad par gyi cha dang mthun pa'i bsam gtan @143b yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
translated: he knows concentration that is conducive to abiding as it really is,🔽he knows concentration that is conducive to distinction as it really is,

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i bsam gtan yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i bsam gtan yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: and he knows concentration that is conducive to penetration as it really is.

original: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
translated: “Householder, thus

original: de bzhin gshegs pas bsam gtan shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bsam gtan shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the Tathāgata knows the knowledge of concentration as it really is.

original: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas rgyu gang dang / rkyen de dag gis yongs su nyams pa'i bsam gtan de dag gi rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /🔽rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis gnas pa'i cha dang mthun par gyur pa de dag gi rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /🔽rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis khyad par gyi cha dang mthun par gyur pa'i bsam gtan de dag gi rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas rgyu gang dang / rkyen de dag gis yongs su nyams pa'i bsam gtan de dag gi rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen / rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis gnas pa'i cha dang mthun par gyur pa de dag gi rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen / rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis khyad par gyi cha dang mthun par gyur pa'i bsam gtan de dag gi rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata also knows perfectly the causes and conditions of those concentrations that are subject to decline,🔽the causes and conditions of those that are conducive to stability,🔽the causes and conditions of those concentrations that are conducive to distinction,

original: rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun par gyur pa'i bsam gtan de dag gi rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun par gyur pa'i bsam gtan de dag gi rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: and the causes and conditions of those concentrations that are conducive to penetration.

original: de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas bsam gtan shes pa de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas bsam gtan shes pa de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Thus the Tathāgata’s knowledge of concentration is perfectly accomplished.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gtan shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar @144a *//🔽te longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gtan shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar @144a *// te longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: “If someone were to ask you, ‘Householder, what is the Tathāgata’s knowledge of concentration?

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: ’ you should answer, ‘The Tathāgata’s knowledge of concentration is the knowledge of the arising and cessation of concentration, and the knowledge of the path and the path to be known.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par thar pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na / de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par thar pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: ’ “If someone were to ask you, ‘Householder, what is the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the path?🔽’ you should answer, ‘The Tathāgata’s knowledge of the path is the knowledge of the path of the noble ones and the knowledge of the path that is not the path of the noble ones.🔽’ “If someone were to ask you, ‘Householder, what is the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the path of the noble ones?🔽’ you should answer, ‘The Tathāgata’s knowledge of the path of the noble ones is the knowledge of the path of the noble ones that is the path of the ten wholesome courses of action.

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par thar pa brgyad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par thar pa brgyad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: ’ “If someone were to ask you, ‘Householder, what is the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the path that is not the path of the noble ones?🔽’ you should answer, ‘The Tathāgata’s knowledge of the path that is not the path of the noble ones is the knowledge of the path that is not the path of the ten wholesome courses of action.

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: ’ “If someone were to ask you, ‘Householder, what is the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the path of the ten wholesome courses of action?🔽’ you should answer, ‘The Tathāgata’s knowledge of the path of the ten wholesome courses of action is the knowledge of the path of the ten wholesome courses of action that is the path of the four kinds of mindfulness.🔽’ “If someone were to ask you, ‘Householder, what is the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the path of the four kinds of mindfulness?

original: gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni /
translated: ’ you should answer, ‘The Tathāgata’s knowledge of the path of the four kinds of mindfulness is the knowledge of the path of the four kinds of mindfulness that is the path of the four right efforts.🔽’ “If someone were to ask you, ‘Householder, what is the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the path of the four right efforts?🔽’

original: rnam par thar pa dang po'o; ;nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa dang po'o; ;nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni /
translated: This is the first liberation.

original: rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o //🔽gtsang ba nyid la mos pa 'di ni /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o // gtsang ba nyid la mos pa 'di ni /
translated: The perception of inner form and the seeing of outer forms is the second liberation.

original: rnam par thar pa gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa gsum pa yin no //
translated: The perception of purity is the third liberation.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam par thar pa dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam par thar pa dang / ci'ang med pa'i skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam par thar pa dang /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam par thar pa dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam par thar pa dang / ci'ang med pa'i skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam par thar pa dang /
translated: The liberation of entering the sphere of infinite space, the liberation of entering the sphere of infinite consciousness, the liberation of entering the sphere of nothingness,

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam par thar pa dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i rnam par thar pa brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam par thar pa dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i rnam par thar pa brgyad pa ste /
translated: the liberation of entering the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, and the liberation of the cessation of perception and feeling are the eighth liberation.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba @144b bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba @144b bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata fully understands these liberations as they are.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par thar pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par thar pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: If you ask the Tathāgata about the knowledge of liberation, he would give an answer for an eon, or even longer than an eon.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The origin, cessation, and path are as taught.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: Householder, how is it that

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ting nge 'dzin shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na; khyim bdag /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ting nge 'dzin shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na; khyim bdag /
translated: the Tathāgata knows the knowledge of samādhi as it really is? Householder,

original: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas ting nge 'dzin bzhi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas ting nge 'dzin bzhi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: here the Tathāgata knows the four samādhis as they really are.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste; shugs ldan zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / sengge zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / zhi ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / chos thams cad kyi rgyud dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste; shugs ldan zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / sengge zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / zhi ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / chos thams cad kyi rgyud dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: They are the samādhi called “Powerful,” the samādhi called “Lion,” the samādhi called “Peace,” and the samādhi called “Endowed with the Stream of All Dharmas.”

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ting nge 'dzin shes pa yang dag pa ji lta bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ting nge 'dzin shes pa yang dag pa ji lta bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata knows as it really is the knowledge of samādhi.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ting nge 'dzin shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //🔽kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no; ;khyim bdag /🔽ji ltar na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ting nge 'dzin shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro // kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no; ;khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: If someone were to ask the Tathāgata a question about that knowledge of samādhi, the Tathāgata would answer it.🔽The Tathāgata would speak for an eon or for the remainder of an eon, and his knowledge of samādhi would not be exhausted.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas snyoms par 'jug pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /🔽khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin @145a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas snyoms par 'jug pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na / khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin @145a *//
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata know the knowledge of samādhi as it really is?

original: gshegs pas bsam gtan la mngon par gnas pa dang / don rtogs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: gshegs pas bsam gtan la mngon par gnas pa dang / don rtogs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, here the Tathāgata knows as it really is the abiding in and realization of the meaning of the dhyānas.🔽“Householder, how does the Tathāgata know the knowledge of the dhātus as it really is?

original: gang dag bsam gtan dang po la brten nas zag pa zad cing don rtogs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / bsam gtan dang po la brten nas mi rtag pa yid la byed pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / bsam gtan dang po la brten nas sdug bsngal yid la byed pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa nas de bzhin du sbyar te phyir rgol ba yid la byed pa'i bar gyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: gang dag bsam gtan dang po la brten nas zag pa zad cing don rtogs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / bsam gtan dang po la brten nas mi rtag pa yid la byed pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / bsam gtan dang po la brten nas sdug bsngal yid la byed pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa nas de bzhin du sbyar te phyir rgol ba yid la byed pa'i bar gyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
translated: Those who, in dependence on the first concentration, have the meditative attainment of the elimination of contaminants and the realization of the meaning, those who, in dependence on the first concentration, have the meditative attainment of bringing to mind impermanence, those who, in dependence on the first concentration, have the meditative attainment of bringing to mind suffering, and similarly, connect this with each, those who have the meditative attainment of bringing to mind the adversary,

original: bsam gtan dang po la brten nas mtshan ma dang bral ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / bsam gtan dang po la brten nas bdag med pa dang bral ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / bsam gtan dang po la brten nas smon lam dang bral ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la brten nas mtshan ma dang bral ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / bsam gtan dang po la brten nas bdag med pa dang bral ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / bsam gtan dang po la brten nas smon lam dang bral ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
translated: those who, in dependence on the first concentration, have the meditative attainment free of signs, those who, in dependence on the first concentration, have the meditative attainment free of selflessness, and those who, in dependence on the first concentration, have the meditative attainment free of aspiration,

original: bsam gtan dang po la brten nas rgyun du 'jug pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / bsam gtan dang po la brten nas dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i bar la snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la brten nas rgyun du 'jug pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / bsam gtan dang po la brten nas dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i bar la snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
translated: There are meditative attainments that manifest the result of stream entry in dependence on the first absorption, up to meditative attainments that manifest the result of an arhat in dependence on the first absorption.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa la brten pa nas bsam gtan bzhi @145b pa la brten pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa la brten pa nas bsam gtan bzhi @145b pa la brten pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
translated: Similarly, there are meditative attainments in dependence on the second absorption, up to those in dependence on the fourth absorption, the meditative attainment of the base of infinite space, the meditative attainment of the base of infinite consciousness,

original: cung zad med pa'i skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar la'ang rgya char bya ste /
analyzed: cung zad med pa'i skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar la'ang rgya char bya ste /
translated: the meditative attainment of the base of nothingness and the meditative attainment of the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment and the meditative attainment of the cessation of discernment and feeling.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata knows it as it really is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa snyoms par 'jug pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa snyoms par 'jug pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one were to ask about the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the absorptions, his answer would lead to a discussion lasting an eon, and so on, up to the enjoyments.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The origin, cessation, and path are as explained above.
